docblock.description: PHPMailer - PHP email transport class NOTE: Requires PHP version 5 or later

tag.name: license
tag.description: http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/lesser.html GNU Lesser General Public License

docblock.description: Main PHPMailer class definition
Email priority (1 = High, 3 = Normal, 5 = low).
Sets the CharSet of the message.
Sets the Content-type of the message.
Sets the Encoding of the message.
docblock.long-description: Options for this are "8bit", "7bit", "binary", "base64", and "quoted-printable".

docblock.description: Holds the most recent mailer error message.
Sets the From email address for the message.
Sets the From name of the message.
Sets the Sender email of the message.
docblock.long-description: If not empty, will be sent via -f to sendmail or as 'MAIL FROM' in smtp mode. If not empty, and ReturnPath is empty, will also be the Return-Path header.

docblock.description: Sets the Return-Path of the message.
docblock.long-description: If empty, it will be set to either From or Sender.

docblock.description: Sets the Subject of the message.
Sets the Body of the message.
docblock.long-description: This can be either an HTML or text body. If HTML then run IsHTML(true).

docblock.description: Sets the text-only body of the message.
docblock.long-description: This automatically sets the email to multipart/alternative. This body can be read by mail clients that do not have HTML email capability such as mutt. Clients that can read HTML will view the normal Body.

docblock.description: Stores the complete compiled MIME message body.
Stores the complete compiled MIME message headers.
Stores the extra header list which CreateHeader() doesn't fold in
Sets word wrapping on the body of the message to a given number of characters.
Method to send mail: ("mail", "sendmail", or "smtp").
Sets the path of the sendmail program.
Determine if mail() uses a fully sendmail compatible MTA that supports sendmail's "-oi -f" options
Path to PHPMailer plugins.
docblock.long-description: Useful if the SMTP class is in a different directory than the PHP include path.

docblock.description: Sets the email address that a reading confirmation will be sent.
Sets the hostname to use in Message-Id and Received headers and as default HELO string.
docblock.long-description: If empty, the value returned by SERVER_NAME is used or 'localhost.localdomain'.

docblock.description: Sets the message ID to be used in the Message-Id header.
docblock.long-description: If empty, a unique id will be generated.

docblock.description: Sets the message Date to be used in the Date header.
docblock.long-description: If empty, the current date will be added.

docblock.description: Sets the SMTP hosts.
docblock.long-description: All hosts must be separated by a semicolon. You can also specify a different port for each host by using this format: [hostname:port] (e.g. "smtp1.example.com:25;smtp2.example.com"). Hosts will be tried in order.

docblock.description: Sets the default SMTP server port.
Sets the SMTP HELO of the message (Default is $Hostname).
Sets connection prefix.
docblock.long-description: Options are "", "ssl" or "tls"

docblock.description: Sets SMTP authentication.
docblock.long-description: Utilizes the Username and Password variables.

docblock.description: Sets SMTP username.
Sets SMTP password.
Sets SMTP auth type.
docblock.long-description: Options are LOGIN | PLAIN | NTLM (default LOGIN)

docblock.description: Sets SMTP realm.
docblock.long-description: @var string

docblock.description: Sets SMTP workstation.
docblock.long-description: @var string

docblock.description: Sets the SMTP server in seconds.
docblock.long-description: This function will not work with the win32 version.

docblock.description: Sets SMTP class debugging on or off.
Sets the function/method to use for debugging output.
docblock.long-description: Right now we only honor "echo" or "error_log"

docblock.description: Prevents the SMTP connection from being closed after each mail sending.
docblock.long-description: If this is set to true then to close the connection requires an explicit call to SmtpClose().

docblock.description: Provides the ability to have the TO field process individual emails, instead of sending to entire TO addresses
If SingleTo is true, this provides the array to hold the email addresses
Provides the ability to change the generic line ending NOTE: The default remains '\n'.
docblock.long-description: We force CRLF where we KNOW it must be used via self::CRLF

docblock.description: Used with DKIM Signing required parameter if DKIM is enabled
docblock.long-description: domain selector example domainkey

docblock.description: Used with DKIM Signing required if DKIM is enabled, in format of email address 'you@yourdomain.com' typically used as the source of the email
Used with DKIM Signing optional parameter if your private key requires a passphras
Used with DKIM Singing required if DKIM is enabled, in format of email address 'domain.com'
Used with DKIM Signing required if DKIM is enabled, path to private key file
Callback Action function name.
docblock.long-description:
The function that handles the result of the send email action. It is called out by Send() for each email sent.

Value can be: - 'function_name' for function names - 'Class::Method' for static method calls - array($object, 'Method') for calling methods on $object See http://php.net/is_callable manual page for more details.

Parameters: bool $result result of the send action string $to email address of the recipient string $cc cc email addresses string $bcc bcc email addresses string $subject the subject string $body the email body string $from email address of sender

docblock.description: Sets the PHPMailer Version number
What to use in the X-Mailer header

tag.name: var
tag.description: NULL for default, whitespace for None, or actual string to use

docblock.description: Calls actual mail() function, but in a safe_mode aware fashion Also, unless sendmail_path points to sendmail (or something that claims to be sendmail), don't pass params (not a perfect fix, but it will do)
Outputs debugging info via user-defined method
Constructor
Sets message type to HTML.
Sets Mailer to send message using SMTP.
Sets Mailer to send message using PHP mail() function.
Sets Mailer to send message using the $Sendmail program.
Sets Mailer to send message using the qmail MTA.
Adds a "To" address.

tag.name: return
tag.description: true on success, false if address already used

docblock.description: Adds a "Cc" address.
docblock.long-description: Note: this function works with the SMTP mailer on win32, not with the "mail" mailer.

tag.name: return
tag.description: true on success, false if address already used

docblock.description: Adds a "Bcc" address.
docblock.long-description: Note: this function works with the SMTP mailer on win32, not with the "mail" mailer.

tag.name: return
tag.description: true on success, false if address already used

docblock.description: Adds a "Reply-to" address.
Adds an address to one of the recipient arrays Addresses that have been added already return false, but do not throw exceptions

tag.name: param
tag.description: The email address to send to

tag.name: return
tag.description: true on success, false if address already used or invalid in some way

docblock.description: Set the From and FromName properties

Check that a string looks roughly like an email address should Static so it can be used without instantiation, public so people can overload Conforms to RFC5322: Uses *correct* regex on which FILTER_VALIDATE_EMAIL is based; So why not use FILTER_VALIDATE_EMAIL? Because it was broken to not allow a@b type valid addresses :(

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: regex Copyright Michael Rushton 2009-10 | http://squiloople.com/ | Feel free to use and redistribute this code. But please keep this copyright notice.

docblock.description: Creates message and assigns Mailer.
docblock.long-description: If the message is not sent successfully then it returns false. Use the ErrorInfo variable to view description of the error.

docblock.description: Prep mail by constructing all message entities
Actual Email transport function Send the email via the selected mechanism
Sends mail using the $Sendmail program.
Sends mail using the PHP mail() function.
Sends mail via SMTP using PhpSMTP Returns false if there is a bad MAIL FROM, RCPT, or DATA input.
Initiates a connection to an SMTP server.
docblock.long-description: Returns false if the operation failed.

docblock.description: Closes the active SMTP session if one exists.
Sets the language for all class error messages.
docblock.long-description: Returns false if it cannot load the language file. The default language is English.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Path to the language file directory

docblock.description: Return the current array of language strings
Creates recipient headers.
Formats an address correctly.
Wraps message for use with mailers that do not automatically perform wrapping and for quoted-printable.
docblock.long-description: Original written by philippe.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The line length to wrap to

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether to run in Quoted-Printable mode

docblock.description: Finds last character boundary prior to maxLength in a utf-8 quoted (printable) encoded string.
docblock.long-description: Original written by Colin Brown.

tag.name: param
tag.description: find last character boundary prior to this length

docblock.description: Set the body wrapping.
Assembles message header.
Returns the message MIME.
Returns the MIME message (headers and body).
docblock.long-description: Only really valid post PreSend().

docblock.description: Assembles the message body.
docblock.long-description: Returns an empty string on failure.

docblock.description: Returns the start of a message boundary.
Returns the end of a message boundary.
Sets the message type.
Returns a formatted header line.
Returns a formatted mail line.
Adds an attachment from a path on the filesystem.
docblock.long-description: Returns false if the file could not be found or accessed.

docblock.description: Return the current array of attachments
Attaches all fs, string, and binary attachments to the message.
docblock.long-description: Returns an empty string on failure.

docblock.description: Encodes attachment in requested format.
docblock.long-description: Returns an empty string on failure.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The full path to the file

tag.name: param
tag.description: The encoding to use; one of 'base64', '7bit', '8bit', 'binary', 'quoted-printable'

docblock.description: Encodes string to requested format.
docblock.long-description: Returns an empty string on failure.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The encoding to use; one of 'base64', '7bit', '8bit', 'binary', 'quoted-printable'

docblock.description: Encode a header string to best (shortest) of Q, B, quoted or none.
Checks if a string contains multibyte characters.
Correctly encodes and wraps long multibyte strings for mail headers without breaking lines within a character.
docblock.long-description: Adapted from a function by paravoid at http://uk.php.net/manual/en/function.mb-encode-mimeheader.php

docblock.description: Encode string to quoted-printable.
docblock.long-description: Only uses standard PHP, slow, but will always work

tag.name: param
tag.description: Number of chars allowed on a line before wrapping

docblock.description: Encode string to RFC2045 (6.7) quoted-printable format Uses a PHP5 stream filter to do the encoding about 64x faster than the old version Also results in same content as you started with after decoding

tag.name: param
tag.description: Number of chars allowed on a line before wrapping

tag.name: param
tag.description: Dummy param for compatibility with existing EncodeQP function

docblock.description: Encode string to q encoding.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Where the text is going to be used, see the RFC for what that means

docblock.description: Adds a string or binary attachment (non-filesystem) to the list.
docblock.long-description: This method can be used to attach ascii or binary data, such as a BLOB record from a database.

docblock.description: Adds an embedded attachment.
docblock.long-description: This can include images, sounds, and just about any other document. Make sure to set the $type to an image type. For JPEG images use "image/jpeg" and for GIF images use "image/gif".

tag.name: param
tag.description: Content ID of the attachment. Use this to identify the Id for accessing the image in an HTML form.

docblock.description: Returns true if an inline attachment is present.
Clears all recipients assigned in the TO array.
docblock.long-description: Returns void.

docblock.description: Clears all recipients assigned in the CC array.
docblock.long-description: Returns void.

docblock.description: Clears all recipients assigned in the BCC array.
docblock.long-description: Returns void.

docblock.description: Clears all recipients assigned in the ReplyTo array.
docblock.long-description: Returns void.

docblock.description: Clears all recipients assigned in the TO, CC and BCC array.
docblock.long-description: Returns void.

docblock.description: Clears all previously set filesystem, string, and binary attachments.
docblock.long-description: Returns void.

docblock.description: Clears all custom headers.
docblock.long-description: Returns void.

docblock.description: Adds the error message to the error container.
Returns the proper RFC 822 formatted date.
Returns the server hostname or 'localhost.localdomain' if unknown.
Returns a message in the appropriate language.
Returns true if an error occurred.
Changes every end of line from CRLF, CR or LF to $this->LE.
Adds a custom header.
docblock.long-description: $name value can be overloaded to contain both header name and value (name:value)

docblock.description: Evaluates the message and returns modifications for inline images and backgrounds
Gets the MIME type of the embedded or inline image
Set (or reset) Class Objects (variables)
docblock.long-description: Usage Example: $page->set('X-Priority', '3');

tag.description: Parameter Value NOTE: will not work with arrays, there are no arrays to set/reset

docblock.description: PHPMailer - PHP POP Before SMTP Authentication Class NOTE: Designed for use with PHP version 5 and up

tag.name: license
tag.description: http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/lesser.html Distributed under the Lesser General Public License (LGPL)

docblock.description: POP Before SMTP Authentication Class Version 5.2.2
docblock.long-description:
Orig Author: Richard Davey (rich@corephp.co.uk) Modifications: Andy Prevost Modifications: Jim Jagielski License: LGPL, see PHPMailer License

Specifically for PHPMailer to allow POP before SMTP authentication. Does not yet work with APOP - if you have an APOP account, contact Jim Jagielski and we can test changes to this script.

This class is based on the structure of the SMTP class originally authored by Chris Ryan

This class is rfc 1939 compliant and implements all the commands required for POP3 connection, authentication and disconnection.

docblock.description: Default POP3 port
Default Timeout
POP3 Carriage Return + Line Feed
Displaying Debug warnings? (0 = now, 1+ = yes)
POP3 Mail Server
POP3 Port
POP3 Timeout Value
POP3 Username
POP3 Password
Sets the POP3 PHPMailer Version number
Constructor, sets the initial values
Combination of public events - connect, login, disconnect
Connect to the POP3 server
Login to the POP3 server (does not support APOP yet)
Disconnect from the POP3 server
Get the socket response back.
docblock.long-description: $size is the maximum number of bytes to retrieve

docblock.description: Send a string down the open socket connection to the POP3 server
Checks the POP3 server response for +OK or -ERR
If debug is enabled, display the error message array
Takes over from PHP for the socket warning handler

docblock.description: PHPMailer - PHP SMTP email transport class NOTE: Designed for use with PHP version 5 and up

tag.name: license
tag.description: http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/lesser.html Distributed under the Lesser General Public License (LGPL)

docblock.description: SMTP is rfc 821 compliant and implements all the rfc 821 SMTP commands except TURN which will always return a not implemented error.
docblock.long-description: SMTP also provides some utility methods for sending mail to an SMTP server. original author: Chris Ryan

docblock.description: SMTP server port
docblock.long-description: @var int

docblock.description: SMTP reply line ending (don't change)
docblock.long-description: @var string

docblock.description: Sets whether debugging is turned on
docblock.long-description: @var bool

docblock.description: Sets the function/method to use for debugging output.
docblock.long-description: Right now we only honor "echo" or "error_log"

docblock.description: Sets VERP use on/off (default is off)
docblock.long-description: @var bool

docblock.description: Sets the SMTP timeout value for reads, in seconds
Sets the SMTP timelimit value for reads, in seconds
Sets the SMTP PHPMailer Version number
Outputs debugging info via user-defined method
Initialize the class so that the data is in a known state.
Connect to the server specified on the port specified.
docblock.long-description:
If the port is not specified use the default SMTP_PORT. If tval is specified then a connection will try and be established with the server for that number of seconds. If tval is not specified the default is 30 seconds to try on the connection.

SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 220 SMTP CODE FAILURE: 421

docblock.description: Initiate a TLS communication with the server.
docblock.long-description: SMTP CODE 220 Ready to start TLS SMTP CODE 501 Syntax error (no parameters allowed) SMTP CODE 454 TLS not available due to temporary reason

docblock.description: Performs SMTP authentication.
docblock.long-description: Must be run after running the Hello() method. Returns true if successfully authenticated.

docblock.description: Returns true if connected to a server otherwise false
Closes the socket and cleans up the state of the class.
docblock.long-description: It is not considered good to use this function without first trying to use QUIT.

docblock.description: Issues a data command and sends the msg_data to the server finializing the mail transaction.
docblock.long-description:
$msg_data is the message that is to be send with the headers. Each header needs to be on a single line followed by a with the message headers and the message body being seperated by and additional .

Implements rfc 821: DATA

SMTP CODE INTERMEDIATE: 354 [data] . SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 250 SMTP CODE FAILURE: 552,554,451,452 SMTP CODE FAILURE: 451,554 SMTP CODE ERROR : 500,501,503,421

docblock.description: Sends the HELO command to the smtp server.
docblock.long-description:
This makes sure that we and the server are in the same known state.

Implements from rfc 821: HELO

SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 250 SMTP CODE ERROR : 500, 501, 504, 421

docblock.description: Sends a HELO/EHLO command.
Starts a mail transaction from the email address specified in $from.
docblock.long-description:
Returns true if successful or false otherwise. If True the mail transaction is started and then one or more Recipient commands may be called followed by a Data command.

Implements rfc 821: MAIL FROM:

SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 250 SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 552,451,452 SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 500,501,421

docblock.description: Sends the quit command to the server and then closes the socket if there is no error or the $close_on_error argument is true.
docblock.long-description:
Implements from rfc 821: QUIT

SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 221 SMTP CODE ERROR : 500

docblock.description: Sends the command RCPT to the SMTP server with the TO: argument of $to.
docblock.long-description:
Returns true if the recipient was accepted false if it was rejected.

Implements from rfc 821: RCPT TO:

SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 250,251 SMTP CODE FAILURE: 550,551,552,553,450,451,452 SMTP CODE ERROR : 500,501,503,421

docblock.description: Sends the RSET command to abort and transaction that is currently in progress.
docblock.long-description:
Returns true if successful false otherwise.

Implements rfc 821: RSET

SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 250 SMTP CODE ERROR : 500,501,504,421

docblock.description: Starts a mail transaction from the email address specified in $from.
docblock.long-description:
Returns true if successful or false otherwise. If True the mail transaction is started and then one or more Recipient commands may be called followed by a Data command. This command will send the message to the users terminal if they are logged in and send them an email.

Implements rfc 821: SAML FROM:

SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 250 SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 552,451,452 SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 500,501,502,421

docblock.description: This is an optional command for SMTP that this class does not support.
docblock.long-description:
This method is here to make the RFC821 Definition complete for this class and may be implimented in the future

Implements from rfc 821: TURN

SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 250 SMTP CODE FAILURE: 502 SMTP CODE ERROR : 500, 503

docblock.description: Get the current error
Read in as many lines as possible either before eof or socket timeout occurs on the operation.
docblock.long-description: With SMTP we can tell if we have more lines to read if the 4th character is '-' symbol. If it is a space then we don't need to read anything else.
